Posts.Content: ravs wrote: Hi I live in England where Proton Beam Therapy is still not adopted by the Government-run NHS. So oncs are not recommening that to any patients. Has anyone on this forum been recommended this therapy and has any experience of it? I would like to knowÂ if there are positive results, then I am planning to seek an opinion whether my oncologist can recommend that for me. Thanks in advance. Ravs Dx 11/6/2011, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 11/15/2011 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Fluorouracil (5-fluorouracil, 5-FU, Adrucil) Hormonal Therapy 3/10/2012 Chemotherapy 6/4/2013 Taxotere (docetaxel) Chemotherapy 10/10/2013 Xeloda (capecitabine) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Has anybody been recommended Proton Beam therapy? ravs ravs

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2011 05:34AM ravs wrote: Mine hasnt been scheduled yet, but it looks likely that they will start chemo Dec and then advice Mast or Lumpectomy later. I live in Mumbai while my husband is in London so its stresssful as it is. However I think this forum is very supportive and I find myself visiting this page everyday nearly. Thanks everyone for giving support and help.
